abstract: Bank of America, citing “recessionary conditions,” halved its dividend on Monday and said it would sell at least $10 billion in new common stock to bolster its capital to offset rising loan losses.
lead_paragraph: Bank of America, citing “recessionary conditions,” halved its dividend on Monday and said it would sell at least $10 billion in new common stock to bolster its capital to offset rising loan losses.

headline.main: BofA to Sell Stock, Cut Dividend After Earnings Slide

abstract: Bank of America piled on the bad news last night, reporting weak earnings that missed analysts’ average estimates by 68 percent as it stepped on some bombs while navigating through the subprime minefield. The company said it saw an uptick in losses connected to loans, credit cards, as well as old favorites like mortgages.
lead_paragraph: Bank of America piled on the bad news last night, reporting weak earnings that missed analysts’ average estimates by 68 percent as it stepped on some bombs while navigating through the subprime minefield. The company said it saw an uptick in losses connected to loans, credit cards, as well as old favorites like mortgages.
